example.text: EXTENDING PROTECTIONS FOR VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS Nicolas Maduro and his illegitimate regime have wreaked havoc on Venezuela. Maduro's corruption and brutal repression has led to widespread violence, political persecution, and food and medicine shortages throughout the country.

This effort started a few years back, when a group of Coloradans from Loveland began a community-led effort to install a sculpture commemorating the pioneers of the women's suffrage movement in Washington, DC Their effort required an act of Congress, and in 2020, we passed bipartisan legislation to establish the monument. After a robust process to pick a site for the monument, those involved in the effort chose the National Mall.

CELEBRATING EQUALITY AT THE WHITE HOUSE Last week, I spoke on the floor of the Senate to honor the victims and survivors of the Club Q tragedy and to urge my colleagues to pass the Respect for Marriage Act. On Tuesday, I joined President Joe Biden at the White House for the signing of this bipartisan bill recognizing same-sex marriage at the federal level and taking a step toward equality for LGBTQ people across the country.
They call them--I am now not quoting the Senator from Alabama; I am quoting others who have written about this. They have called them ``disgusting.''

Coloradans understand there is no right closer to the heart than marrying the one that you love. HONORING PIONEERS OF WOMEN'S SUFFRAGE This week, I joined my colleagues in introducing a bill to install a national monument to women's suffrage on the National Mall.

A message from Senator Michael Bennet Hello everyone, This week, I'm on a bipartisan Congressional Delegation to the Middle East and North Africa to reinforce our bipartisan commitment to the Abraham Accords, historic peace agreements to foster normalization, cooperation and integration across the region. Over the week, we're visiting member countries of the Accords, including Israel, the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain, and Morocco, to explore opportunities to build on the agreements and advance progress across key issues like security and energy.

This effort started a few years back, when a group of Coloradans from Loveland began a community-led effort to install a sculpture commemorating the pioneers of the women's suffrage movement in Washington, DC Their effort required an act of Congress, and in 2020, we passed bipartisan legislation to establish the monument. After a robust process to pick a site for the monument, those involved in the effort chose the National Mall.
